Forwarded from: Igor Dodon

event: Estonia Announces Military Aid Package for Ukraine
description: Estonian Defense Minister Hanno Pevkur announced a 20 million euro military aid package for Ukraine, including 155 mm artillery shells, anti-tank guns, explosive devices, gas masks, and sniper equipment. The package is part of the European Union's initiative to supply one million projectiles to Ukraine.
original: A new aid package for Ukraine from Estonia Estonian Defense Minister Hanno Pevkur announced that Estonia will send Ukraine the next package of military aid worth 20 million euros, according to the website of the Ministry of Defense. In particular, the most important item in this package is 155 mm artillery shells, which is Estonia's contribution to the initiative of the European Union regarding the supply of one million projectiles to Ukraine. The exact number is not being disclosed for security reasons. The package will also include: Anti-tank guns; Explosive devices; Gas masks; Sniper equipment; very needed But it also clearly showed that Ukraine, moving towards the summer, needs first of all: ammunition, all elements of air defense, as well as spare parts and means of radio-electronic warfare," commented Minister Pevkur after a meeting with the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umerov. 🫡Estonia actively joins supporting and strengthening the defense capability of Ukraine by providing a large amount of various aid.MapBlogWrite to usZSUHelpMagazinDonat

event: Agreement on Shipping in the Red Sea
description: China and Russia have reached an agreement with the Houthis, allowing their ships to pass through the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden without being attacked. In return, the two countries will provide political support to the Houthis in international bodies such as the UN Security Council.
original:
China and Russia have reached an agreement with the Houthis on shipping in the Red Sea, Bloomberg reports.

According to the newspaper's sources, the Yemen-based Houthis have told China and Russia that their ships can freely pass through the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden without being attacked.

According to sources, in exchange for this, the two countries can provide political support to the Houthis in bodies such as the UN Security Council. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Vladimir Putin Declared President of Russia
description: The Central Election Commission of Russia officially declared Vladimir Putin President of Russia, with a record 87.25% of Russians voting in his favor. The election saw a historical record of 87,576,075 people participating, demonstrating unprecedented support for the current president.
original:
⠀🇷🇺The Central Election Commission of Russia officially declared Vladimir Putin President of Russia.

In 2024, 87,576,075 people (77.49%) voted in the elections, a historical record.

The country expressed unprecedented support for the current president. 87.25% of Russians voted for Vladimir Putin.

During these days, our Situation Center for Election Monitoring, together with more than 150,000 independent public observers, has done a tremendous amount of work. The Russian presidential elections were held with high quality and a clean count of votes. With a record turnout, only minor deviations from the “Gold Standard of the OP RF” elections were recorded, which not a single international observer who was present at the polling stations these days has refuted and will be able to refute. Objective information, meetings with eyewitnesses and participants in the events, analytics - subscribe to channel of Maxim Grigoriev.

event: Attack on Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs Employees
description: A criminal case was opened in Lugansk after an attack on Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs employees. On March 20, officers pursuing a suspect were targeted by an explosive device at a traffic light in Olkhovsky city, Lugansk. Five officers were injured, and one man died. Investigators are working to establish the circumstances of the incident.
original:
⚡️A criminal case has been opened in Lugansk regarding an attack on the lives of employees of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs

The investigative bodies of the investigative department of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation for the Lugansk People's Republic opened a criminal case on the grounds of a crime under Art. 317 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (attack on the life of a law enforcement officer).

The investigation established that in the evening of March 20 of this year, officers of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs were pursuing a suspect of committing a particularly serious crime. At the traffic light located in the apt. Olkhovsky city of Lugansk, they removed the man from the taxi in which he was traveling, at that moment the attacker detonated an explosive device. Five law enforcement officers received shrapnel wounds and contusions; a man, whose identity is currently being established, died. The driver of the vehicle was not injured.

Investigators of the Leninsky Investigation Department for the city of Lugansk and criminologists inspected the scene of the incident, seized particles and objects of interest to the investigation, and ordered the necessary examinations.

In cooperation with the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the LPR, investigators continue to establish all the circumstances, including the causes and conditions of the incident.

The criminal investigation continues.@luhansktoday

description: Russian troops struck the State Enterprise NPKG 'Zorya' - 'Mashproekt' facility in Nikolaev, a key enterprise in Ukraine's defense industrial complex. The facility produces radio electronics, control systems, and high-tech components for military use, and is involved in modernizing Ukrainian warships. The drying workshop was hit by a ballistic missile, affecting the manufacturing process of high-tech products.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
Strike at the enemy’s military-industrial complex facility in Nikolaev About an hour ago, Russian troops struck the territory of the State Enterprise NPKG “Zorya” - “Mashproekt”, which is one of the key enterprises of the Ukrainian defense industrial complex. The enterprise specializes in the production of radio electronics, control systems and other high-tech components for military use. It actively cooperates with military and scientific institutions of Ukraine, as well as with Western countries - its products are used in various types of weapons.

In addition, the Zarya plant is actively involved in the modernization and reconstruction of Ukrainian warships, including the development and installation of electronic control and navigation systems. Its activities are of strategic importance for Ukraine and the maintenance of military-defense potential. Coordinates: 46.9324799, 32.0480408 The drying workshop of the enterprise was hit by a ballistic missile. The affected object plays a key role in the manufacturing process of high-tech products, since proper drying of materials affects their quality and characteristics. There is no extent of damage or information about the possibilities for further implementation of activities. Lately, a certain systematic pattern of striking targets of the enemy’s military-industrial complex in the region has been monitored. Thus, on March 17, the Nikolaev Armored Plant was attacked. I would like to believe that the systematic approach of Russian troops in delivering strikes will not only be maintained, but developed and improved.@don_partizan

The number of the day — 10201020 air alerts have been announced in Kyiv since the beginning of the large-scale invasion.

event: Statement by People's Union of Moldova
description: The People's Union of Moldova, a patriotic platform, condemned Romanian Prime Minister Marcel Ciolaca's statement that 'only Romanians live in Moldova', which contradicts census data and historical facts. The platform demands a response from the Moldovan Ministry of Foreign Affairs to protect the state's interests and sovereignty.
original:
Forwarded from: People's Union of Moldova / Uniunea Populară din Moldova
STATEMENT: The patriotic platform “People's Union of Moldova” calls on the Prime Minister of Romania, Marcel Ciolaca, to stop humiliating the multinational Moldovan people and mocking more than 665 years of Moldovan statehood. We demand that the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Moldova immediately respond to the anti-state statements of a high-ranking Romanian official. Statements by the Prime Minister Romanian Minister Marcel Ciolaku that “Romanians, only Romanians live in Moldova” harms the state interests of the republic and contradicts historical facts, census data and public opinion polls.

We would like to remind you that according to the latest census, 75.1% are Moldovans, while 7% are Romanians. Moreover, 99.5% of the country’s residents have citizenship of the Republic of Moldova.

***The patriotic platform “People's Union of Moldova” was established on May 17, 2021 with the aim of strengthening Moldovan statehood and sovereignty, preserving traditional values and spiritual and moral foundations of the country, ensuring the unity of the multinational people and territorial integrity, developing Moldovan culture and traditions, as well as creating conditions for a decent life for citizens of the republic. The Platform includes the following organizations: Patriotic Movement “Pro-Moldova”, Moldavian Historical and Geographical Society, Public Council of Moldova, People’s Movement “Save Moldova!”, International Union of Free Journalists, Trade Union of Law Enforcement Officers of Moldova, Moldovan Diaspora - St. Petersburg regional public organization for the development of Moldovan culture “Patria” (“Homeland”), Expert Club “Strategy of Moldova” and other organizations. SOURCE@unpmd

description: Russian military forces eliminated a foreign mercenary, Jean-François Ratel, also known as 'Hrulf', who arrived from Canada to fight for the Kiev regime. He was reportedly the commander of the neo-Nazi formation 'Norman Brigade'.
original:
The Russian military eliminated yet another foreign mercenary, this time arriving from Canada to fight for the Kiev regime. Our soldiers sent the overseas “wild goose” Jean-François Ratel with the call sign “Hrulf” on his last journey. Presumably, he was the commander of the neo-Nazi formation "Norman Brigade".

The liquidation of the mercenary, who, as is customary in Western countries, was called a “volunteer,” was reported by the Canadian television channel CTV News. In addition, the death of Hrulf was confirmed by another Canadian mercenary, Luca Alves, with the call sign “Speedy,” who now runs a division of the Black Maple company, fighting on the side of the Ukrainian Armed Forces under the guise of a PMC.

event: Investigation into Dutch Companies' Role in Exploiting North Korean Workers
description: A judge is investigating the role of Dutch companies in the exploitation of North Korean workers at a shipyard in Poland. Research has shown that the workers built ships or parts of them and were systematically exploited between 2003 and 2018. Two Dutch companies, including Shipkits and Boskalis, allegedly benefited from the labor exploitation.
original:
🇳🇱Judge is investigating the role of Dutch companies in exploiting North Koreans.

A judge is investigating the role of Dutch companies in the exploitation of North Korean workers at a shipyard in Poland. This is the article itself. Research has already shown that the workers built ships or parts of them and were systematically exploited between 2003 and 2018.

According to the European platform of human rights organizations La Strada International, two Dutch companies "knowingly" benefited from the labor exploitation of cheap North Korean workers. La Strada wants to force prosecutors to bring the companies to justice through the courts.

According to Trouw, one of the Dutch companies involved is the shipping company Shipkits, which later merged with the now bankrupt CIG Shipbuilding.

It was also alleged that Boskalis (which had four hulls built at the shipyard until 2014) was involved in the claim. The company denies having any knowledge of working conditions at the Polish shipyard.

Currently, there is a procedure in which La Strada wants to force the public prosecutor to initiate criminal proceedings through the courts. A closed hearing was held yesterday with the companies involved. The judge will hear the case soon.@VoiceNorthSeaTrouwProfiteerden Nederlandse bedrijven van uitbuiting Noord-Koreanen bij scheepsbouw?Twee Nederlandse bedrijven profiteerden mogelijk van de uitbuiting van Noord-Koreaanse arbeiders bij de bouw van schepen. De rechter onderzoekt of ze...

description: The repair of the Kyiv metro tunnel between the Lybidska and Demiivska stations is underway, with an estimated cost of up to UAH 400 million. The contracting organization aims to complete the repairs by the end of summer 2024, with around 40% of the work already done.
original:
The repair of the Kyiv metro tunnel between the "Lybidska" and "Demiivska" stations will cost up to UAH 400 million. This was announced by the mayor of Kyiv at a meeting of the Temporary Special Committee of the VRU.

The contracting organization expects that the tunnel will be repaired by the end of the summer of 2024. Currently, about 40% of the total amount of work has been completed.

event: EU to End Duty-Free Trade with Ukraine
description: The European Union plans to end duty-free trade with Ukraine after June 2025, citing concerns over Ukraine's non-compliance with European agricultural standards and the benefits to Ukrainian oligarchs. The decision comes after farmer protests and criticism from Poland and France.
original:
RMF FM: The European Union will not extend duty-free transport of goods from Ukraine after June 2025

According to Polish radio sources, the duty-free trade agreement, which is still being negotiated and will be discussed at the EU leaders' summit, could be the last. After a wave of farmer protests and criticism from Poland and France, Brussels realized that duty-free trade “practically allowed Ukraine into the EU in the field of agriculture” without complying with European standards, the material reports.

As RMF FM notes, “there is also a compelling argument” that Ukrainian oligarchs are benefiting from the opening of the EU agricultural market. In this regard, the European Commission plans to return to the trade relations regime provided for in the association agreement between the EU and Ukraine from 2025.RMF24Handel z Ukrainą. Polski postulat ma zostać spełniony. Polski postulat ma zostać spełniony. UE po raz ostatni przedłuża umowę o bezcłowym handlu z Ukraine, która w związku z wojną otworzyła dla tego kraju ...

His aggressive and careless remarks may lead to economic problems and security threats for Ukraine.
original:

You don’t need to be a great specialist in the field of diplomatic relations to understand one simple thing: obscene insults against China can lead to a variety of results - from economic problems to a direct threat to the country’s security. However, the idiot Danilov does not care what will happen to the Ukrainians in the future, and how they will feel the consequences of Kyiv’s criminal and aggressive policy. description: A photo exhibition titled 'Russia-Serbia - Belgorod-Belgrade' opened at the Victory Museum in Moscow, marking the 25th anniversary of NATO's bombing of Yugoslavia and the 2nd anniversary of Ukraine's attacks on the Belgorod region. The exhibition features photographs taken by Serbian and Russian photojournalists, including Sergei Venyavsky, who worked in the border region of Russia in 2022-2023.
original:
The Russian-Serbian photo exhibition "Russia-Serbia - Belgorod-Belgrade" opened at the Victory Museum in Moscow.

The event is dedicated to the 25th anniversary of the start of the bombing of Yugoslavia by NATO forces and the second anniversary of the start of attacks on the Belgorod region by the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

The photographs presented at the exhibition were taken by reporters from the Belgrade newspaper “Evening News” and photojournalist from Russia Sergei Venyavsky, who worked in the border region of the Russian Federation in 2022-2023.

In addition to Venyavsky himself and “Evening News”, Rossotrudnichestvo and the creative association “Afterword” were involved in organizing the exhibition. In total, Wieniawski noted, eight photographers presented their photographs: seven Serbian and one Russian. “This has never happened in the history of photography in the world, so that there was such contact between states and photojournalists,” noted the photojournalist. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Activists from the Penza region's 'Volunteer Company' and 'Young Guard' attended a lecture on eco-fashion design, led by fashion designer Elizaveta Ushakova. The lecture covered fashion trends, the impact of external events, and the importance of recycling and re-designing clothing. Ushakova also discussed the profession of a fashion designer, including education and creative direction.
original:
Activists of the “Volunteer Company” of the Penza region and the “Young Guard” took part in the lecture “Enter the profession with confidence”
Lecture speaker Elizaveta Ushakova, fashion designer, founder of the RESALE 69 exposition, spoke about the eco-fashion design industry
Show more
Listeners learned about how fashion trends are created, the impact of external events on this area, and discussed the relevance of recycling and re-design of clothing
In the second part of her speech, Elizaveta Ushakova spoke directly about the profession of a fashion designer: how clothing design is created, where you can get the appropriate education, the difference between this creative direction and others
“The event was held as part of the project “Into the Profession with Confidence,” where everyone can learn more about work in various fields and ask questions of interest to representatives of the profession. This is already the second lecture, and the guys come with interest to listen to experienced specialists,” emphasized the activists of the “Volunteer Company” of the Penza region.
#VolunteerRota
#Penza region

event: Dmitry Ivanov Sent to Punishment Cell
description: Dmitry Ivanov, author of the 'Protest MGU' channel, was sent to a punishment cell for 10 days for allegedly refusing to clean the quarantine zone. Ivanov is serving an 8.5-year sentence in IK-3, Tambov, for publishing information about Russian war crimes in Mariupol.
original:
The author of the tg channel “Protest MGU”, Dmitry Ivanov, was sent to a punishment cell. According to members of his support group, the political prisoner was sent to a punishment cell for 10 days for allegedly “refusing to clean the quarantine zone.” Today Ivanov was visited by a lawyer, they added.

Dmitry Ivanov is serving his sentence in IK-3 in the Tambov village of Zeleny. Previously, he was sentenced to 8.5 years in prison for “fakes” about the army due to publications about Russian war crimes in Mariupol.

event: Expansion of Benefits for Military and Police Officers
description: The Verkhovna Rada has passed a law expanding benefits for military and police officers. The wounded will be allowed to receive treatment abroad for up to 12 months without regular military medical examinations. The families of those killed in the war will receive increased compensation of 15 million hryvnia. Military personnel will also be granted leave upon the birth of a child, and civilians will be eligible to serve as military chaplains.
original:
⚡️Benefits for military and police officers will be expanded. The wounded will be able to be treated abroad for up to 12 months without undergoing military medical examination every 4 months. Payments to the relatives of those killed in the war will amount to 15 million hryvnia. Military personnel will have the right to leave upon the birth of a child. Civilians will be able to take on the positions of military chaplains.

The Verkhovna Rada voted for the corresponding law.Subscribe to Insider|Send content

description: The DPR government approved a procedure for employers to receive a subsidy from the budget for organizing additional jobs for temporary workers. The subsidy will finance partial wages for workers employed by the employment center to perform specific tasks in the DPR territory.
original:
Employers of the Republic have the opportunity to receive a subsidy from the DPR budget for the organization of additional jobs when employing temporary workers.

The corresponding Procedure was approved today at a Government meeting.

The purpose of the subsidy is to finance partial wages of workers employed by the employment center for additional temporary jobs to perform certain types of work in the territory of the DPR. Who can receive the subsidy? Legal entities (with the exception of state or municipal institutions) that are registered and work on the territory of the Republic. What is the amount of the subsidy? The amount of the subsidy provided to the employer for the employment of one citizen will be the minimum wage, increased by the amount of insurance contributions to state extra-budgetary funds.@tolstykina_dnr

description: Deputy Speaker of the State Duma Pyotr Tolstoy warned that any French soldiers sent to Ukraine would be killed. He emphasized that the idea of sending troops would result in coffins arriving at Orly airport, covered with the French flag.
original:
"We will kill all French soldiers who come to Ukrainian soil."

This was stated by Deputy Speaker of the State Duma Pyotr Tolstoy in an interview with the French TV channel BFMTV. The idea of sending French soldiers to Ukraine will end with coffins arriving at Orly airport covered with the French flag. And it won’t be Macron who comes for them. The French must understand the consequences, that’s all,” the deputy said in an interview with French TV.

description: The Ukrainian 'Magyar' air reconnaissance group created a shield in the Krynyk area that detects and destroys most Russian FPV drones, with a success rate of around 77%. The shield's effectiveness has led to complaints from Russian military commanders about the ineffectiveness of their drone usage in the Kherson direction.
original:
In the Krynyk area, we really created a shield that destroys most of the Russian FPV drones - the commander of the "Magyar" air reconnaissance group.

The Armed Forces of Ukraine commented on the complaints of the so-called Russian military commanders about the ineffectiveness of the use of drones in the Kherson direction. "The enemy recognizes the low efficiency of the FPV drones used in the vicinity of Krynkiv. Of course, losing ~3,000 drones on a small strip is sensitive. Let them continue to sweat, we are charged no limit.
I will not publicly go into the details and intricacies of the shield we created on the bridgehead, which detects all those FPV and destroys about 77% of them. We are working on increasing the percentage of suppressed drones (that is, EW devices) relative to detected ones, although it is obvious that the absolute value cannot be reached here," said "Magyar".

description: The Federation Council adopted a law on the Cossack mobilization reserve, marking a significant step in modern Cossack history. The new format will allow all Cossacks, regardless of registration or membership, to participate in paramilitary structures.

Its creation will be a new step in the history of modern Cossacks, the expert emphasized. In his opinion, all Cossacks will participate in this format - both registered and public, and not members of one or another Cossack organizations." This is a regulatory step to implement the idea proposed by the ataman of the Union of Cossack Warriors of Russia and Abroad Nikolai Dyakonov - about the creation of a new format of Cossack troops not in the form of NGOs, but precisely in the form of such paramilitary structures,” Bredikhin noted. description: NATO's support of Ukraine has depleted its own weapon stockpiles, jeopardizing Europe's defense against a potential Russian invasion. 💰🇪🇺💰The Consequences of the Militarization of EuropeThe Wall Street Journal: NATO, meanwhile, has depleted its own stockpiles of weapons to support Ukraine. And the creation of a reliable defense in Europe to protect against a possible invasion by the Russian Federation, especially given the threat of US non-intervention, will jeopardize the current social model of the European Union.

WSJ denotes the key geostrategic consequence of militarization for Europe - the destruction of the existing social model of the European Union, and therefore the organization itself.

The existing model of hyperconsumption in Europe was based on pumping resources from other continents through unfair exchange + cheaper pipeline gas from the Russian Federation + minimal militarization, which was achieved:

A) thanks to the American Umbrella:
B) arms limitation treaties with the USSR/Russia.

Considering that there is no one else to restrain a united Europe, this was the key to a huge economic reserve. And now all this has been destroyed, and Europe will have to tighten its belts, which is guaranteed to lead to its disintegration, followed by fragmentation into small blocks based on interests.

description: A seven-year-old boy in Moscow suffered severe abuse at the hands of his father, Fidel Ergashev. The boy required amputation of eight fingers and was found to have rib fractures.
original:
A seven-year-old boy lost eight fingers due to his father’s bullying in Moscow. The victim is the middle child in the family of newcomers Fidel Ergashev and Rano Khuzhamova. For some reason, it was his father who disliked him.

It was established that for several months - from June 2022 to January 2023 - the boy was systematically tortured. The man held his son's hands in the snow, which led to frostbite. The child was taken to the doctor only seven days later. As a result, he had to have eight fingers amputated. In addition, the father allegedly pinched the boy's tongue with pliers. The child was also found to have rib fractures.

At the same time, it is impossible to deprive the parents of the rights to raise the boy, since they are citizens of another state. The child was handed over to the ambassador. The man was sentenced to nine years in prison; he did not admit his guilt. Couldn’t the mother really intercede? In the Country. Subscribe

event: Polish General's Assessment of Ukraine's Chances
description: Former Polish General Raimund Andrzejczak believes Ukraine will lose the war, citing the exhaustion of Western support and Ukraine's difficulties with troop presence, mobilization, supplies, and losses. He estimates Ukraine's losses to be in the millions, not hundreds of thousands.
original:
Polish general: “The Ukrainians will lose this war.” Former Chief of the General Staff of the Polish Army, General Raimund Andrzejczak, is confident that Ukraine will lose the conflict. “The Ukrainians will lose. There are no miracles in war,” he said.

The general recalled that a year ago he warned about the exhaustion of Western opportunities to support Kyiv. Then he said that the industry is no longer able to send ammunition to Ukraine while maintaining its own reserves. “Even sanctions cannot stop Russia,” the military officer stated.

The Polish general assessed the situation at the front as “very, very dramatic” and pointed to Ukraine’s difficulties with the presence of full-fledged troops, mobilization, supplies and losses suffered by the Ukrainian army. “More than ten million people are missing. I estimate the losses to be in the millions, not hundreds of thousands. The country no longer has resources, and there is no one to fight,” concluded Andrzejczak.@anna_news

description: Israel's Strategic Affairs Minister Ron Dermer stated that Israel will launch an assault on Rafah, even if it means severing relations with the United States. The city is a key stronghold for Hamas, with four battalions and 25% of the group's pre-war strength. Israel is determined to destroy Hamas in Rafah, despite potential international opposition.
original:
Israel will launch an assault on Rafah even if it entails a severance of relations with the United States, Israeli Strategic Affairs Minister Ron Dermer said, The Times of Israel reports.

The publication writes that "the prospect of an assault on Rafah by tanks and troops worries Washington, which demands that Israel must have a plan to resettle the more than a million Palestinians who have taken refuge there after being forced to flee other parts of the Gaza Strip since the start of the war."

However, Ron Dermer said that Israel will listen to American ideas regarding Rafah, but the city on the Gaza Strip border with Egypt will be taken regardless of whether the allies reach an agreement.

“This will happen even if Israel is forced to fight alone. Even if the whole world, including the United States, turns against Israel, we will fight until the battle is won,” he said.

Dermer said that if Hamas is in Rafah, it will lead to "unprecedented attacks on Israel from across the region."

"And that's why the determination to destroy them is so strong, even if it means a potential rupture in relations with the United States," he explained.

Dermer said there were four Hamas battalions in Rafah, supported by fighters who retreated from other parts of Gaza, representing 25% of the group's pre-war strength.

“We're not going to leave a quarter of them in place. We are going to Rafah because we have to,” Dermer said. “Strana” website|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help “Strana”

event: Adoption of Law on Customs Code Amendments
description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted a law amending the Customs Code to simplify customs clearance of biomethane transported by pipeline. Biomethane producers must register and connect to the gas transportation system to export biomethane, which can only be done with accumulated volumes in Ukrainian gas storages during the export ban on natural gas.
original: 🛢️The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted the Law on Amendments to the Customs Code of Ukraine regarding the customs clearance of biomethane (#9456). From now on, the customs clearance of biomethane, which is moved by pipeline transport, is carried out in the manner provided for natural gas. This means that the customs procedures that are used today for natural gas, will extend their effect to biomethane. In order to export biomethane from Ukraine, biomethane producers must be registered in the biomethane register and be connected to the gas transportation or gas distribution system using an automatic flow device (automatic chromatograph) and a gas metering unit. During the period of the export ban natural gas of Ukrainian origin, export of biomethane transported by pipeline transport can be carried out exclusively in relation to the volumes of biomethane accumulated in gas storages of Ukraine at the end of the month preceding the month of export. 📲DetailsTelegram/ Facebook/ Site /Instagram/ X

description: On September 21, 2022, the Supreme Commander announced Decree #647, initiating partial mobilization in the Russian Federation. Initially, it was believed to be a short-term measure, but as the war progressed, it became clear that the mobilization would continue and the Armed Forces would be expanded.
original:
Forwarded from: Wrong turn🍒
09.21.2022 The Supreme Commander gave a speech, after which Decree #647 “On the announcement of partial mobilization in the Russian Federation” came into force.
Then almost everyone was told that this was purely an adventure for 15 minutes for three to four months and back.
After a while, everyone was waiting for the cancellation of the first wave after the number of contract soldiers had reached an equal number of those called up for mobilization.
After this, a decision was made to increase the staff of the Armed Forces.
Every day, with every news, the understanding grew that the millstones of war had been launched, and the mechanism could not be stopped.
The enemy is ready to fight to the end, as shown by the events on the border.
The Warlord is calling, the drums are beating, the banners are fluttering in the wind...
First of all, this applies to those “called on call” and those with the necessary “rare” specialties. Take care of maintaining physical fitness and health, cure your teeth, prepare a general power of attorney for your loved ones, a will (just in case, no one is insured). Start studying people’s experience with equipment, shoes, bivouac, fortunately, in two years more material has accumulated than in 10 years of active Internet before the strange magical operation.
Study the engineering manuals and the basic required equipment. The rest, if for some reason you have not dealt with this issue in advance, can be purchased during preparation. I don’t think that mistakes will be made, as with those mobilized in the first wave.
First the base, then the tuner for your shooting stick and a fashionable body kit for your helmet. What's the point of them if you can't drag your fancy blaster up the hill, and wet feet and chafed buttocks are putting you out of action?

description: The launch of the Soyuz MS-25 spacecraft has been postponed to March 23 due to a voltage drop in the chemical current source, which was detected during the final stage of pre-launch preparation. The crew has been evacuated from the ship, and a detailed analysis of the reasons for canceling the launch procedure will be conducted.
original:
Forwarded from: Roscosmos State Corporation
Yuri Borisov: the launch of the Soyuz MS-25 spacecraft has been postponed to March 23. The reasons for the cancellation of the launch of the Soyuz-2.1a launch vehicle with the Soyuz MS-25 manned transport spacecraft have been determined, the launch has been postponed to Saturday, March 23, said the General Director of Roscosmos Yuri Borisov. “We have set a reserve date - March 23, 15:36:10 Moscow time.” He said that on Thursday, at the final stage of pre-launch preparation, an emergency situation occurred, as a result of which the launch procedure was interrupted. “The reason has been identified, we only that at a meeting of the state commission it was revealed that the reason was a voltage drop in the chemical current source.” He said that the crew is currently being evacuated from the ship, after which the launch complex will be returned to its original position, then the state commission will conduct a detailed analysis of the reasons for canceling the launch procedure .

Executive Director for Manned Space Programs of Roscosmos Sergei Krikalev said that the automatic systems controlling the launch worked well. “The automation worked when controlling the launch and did not allow the ship’s systems to malfunction. The crew is safe, left the rocket and went to remove the spacesuits.” After the spacesuits are removed, a medical examination of the crew members will be carried out, and then the astronauts will return to quarantine, and further preparations for the launch will continue.

description: Terrorists, allegedly JNIM, attacked a police station in northern Benin, specifically in Angaradaba, resulting in the burning of many police vehicles. The attack is part of the militants' plan to expand their influence in the Gulf of Guinea countries, following their defeats in Burkina Faso.
original: Terrorists, allegedly JNIM*, attacked a police station in northern Benin. As a result of the attack on Angaradaba, many vehicles belonging to the police were burned, casualties are being established. This attack is the implementation of the militants’ plan to expand influence in the countries of the Gulf of Guinea. After defeats in Burkina Faso, they are forced to look for more unprotected and unprepared countries

description: Two years ago, Ukrainian soldiers bravely liberated Moschun, a small village in the Kyiv region, from Russian invaders. The defenders of Ukraine fought fiercely, preventing the enemy from breaking through to Kyiv and protecting the capital.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
Moschun is a place of great courage, a great feat of our people. Two years ago, Ukrainian soldiers liberated this small village in the Kyiv region from the Russian invaders. Heavy battles took place here, the enemy tried to break through to Kyiv. But our Ukrainians did not allow this to happen, they heroically defended Moschun, thus protecting the capital as well.

Honor to the defenders of Ukraine!
Eternal memory to all those who gave their lives for the sake of our state and independence.

event: Alleged Plan to Blow Up Dnipro HPP Dam
description: Russian forces allegedly plan to blow up the Dnipro HPP dam in Zaporizhzhia, but are spreading false information that Ukrainian special services are behind the plot. This is likely an attempt to shift responsibility from themselves to Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: Locator-Media
The occupiers are allegedly preparing to blow up the Dnipro HPP dam in Zaporizhzhia.

They spread the fake news that the Ukrainian special services are preparing to blow up the dam on the Dnipro reservoir. Presumably, they are doing this in order to later shift responsibility from themselves to Ukraine. More here.

description: Belgorod was shelled in the morning, resulting in the blocking of Shchorsa Street. Public transport was detoured as a precautionary measure. A local resident recounted his harrowing experience, having been caught in the shelling while in his car. He managed to escape and took cover around the corner of a nearby building.
original:
In Belgorod, after the morning shelling, Shchorsa Street was blocked; the mayor's office announced that public transport would be detoured.

A man living on this street told RIA Novosti that the shelling caught him in his car, but he managed to jump out and was hiding around the corner of the building.

description: The Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations delivered 29 tons of humanitarian aid to the Egyptian El-Arish airport, which will be transferred to the Gaza Strip through the Egyptian Red Crescent Society.
original:
The Il-76 transport aircraft of the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations delivered 29 tons of humanitarian aid to the Egyptian El-Arish airport for residents of the Gaza Strip, the press service of the ministry told RIA Novosti.
“The Il-76 plane delivered humanitarian aid to the airport in El-Arish. Russian aid will be transferred to representatives of the Egyptian Red Crescent Society, who will transfer it to the Gaza Strip,” the agency’s interlocutor said.

description: The FSB detained a 47-year-old man, Yuri Yaroshenko, in the Belgorod region, accusing him of preparing terrorist attacks against the Russian military. The man allegedly had an explosive device and communicated with Ukrainian special services via instant messengers, providing them with coordinates of Russian military locations.
original:
The FSB reported on the detention in the Belgorod region of a “supporter of the RDK” who was allegedly preparing terrorist attacks against the Russian military. According to the agency, an explosive device was allegedly found in the man’s possession during a search. “According to the attacker, he got in touch with members of the Ukrainian special services in instant messengers. The man sent them the coordinates of the location of the Russian Armed Forces,” writes TASS with reference to the FSB. The Kremlin media also publishes a video of the arrest and “confession” of a man with a covered face. The name of the detainee is not given, but we are probably talking about 47-year-old resident of the Belgorod region Yuri Yaroshenko. he was detained on March 13, 2024, near the Dom Byta shopping center in Belgorod. At that time, no criminal cases were brought against the man, ASTRA found out. The official version is that Yuri allegedly wanted to explode the F-1 grenade on the spot. After his arrest, they allegedly found this grenade and a certain “ampule with liquid” on him. Only 3 days after Yuri’s arrest, they made him a defendant in a criminal case under 3 articles at once: preparation for a terrorist attack, illegal arms trafficking and sabotage. According to investigators, the man allegedly remotely joined the ranks of the RDK, planned to poison food collected for shipment to the Russian military who are taking part in the invasion of Ukraine, and detonate a grenade in a public place in Belgorod.

Interestingly, in the “confession” video the man says that he planned to carry out terrorist attacks in Valuyki. And there is no talk at all about the allegedly found ampoule and the poisoning of the military - although this was initially included in the official version of the Russian investigation, ASTRA found out.

description: A man, previously employed at a gas station in Chekhov, near Moscow, broke in and stole 85,000 rubles from the cash register. He claimed to have been instigated by scammers posing as secret service workers, who convinced him to commit the crime to pay off a supposed large loan.
original:
In Chekhov, near Moscow, a man broke into the building of a gas station where he previously worked and took 85 thousand rubles from the cash register.

After his arrest, the robber said that he committed the crime at the instigation of the scammers. They called him and introduced themselves as secret service workers.

The man was convinced that a large loan had been issued to him. To pay it off, he must rob a gas station, broadcasting what is happening online using his phone.

description: The Central Election Commission announced the official results of the Russian presidential election, with Vladimir Putin winning 87.28% of the vote. The election saw a high turnout, demonstrating unprecedented support for the President from the Russian people.
original:
Forwarded from: BURN
Today, the Central Election Commission announced the official results of the election of the President of the Russian Federation. More than 76 million Russians voted for Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin - 87.28% of the voters who took part in the voting! This colossal figure shows the unprecedented support of the President by the Russian people.
Of course, the outcome of the elections was expected for us; we predicted a high turnout and support for our President! Communicating with the residents of our large country, it was clear to me that the people of Russia want to see Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin as head of state.

Despite Western provocations, the elections were held openly and fairly. Foreign observers who did not succumb to anti-Russian information pressure could be convinced of this.

Today we have united around a strong leader who defends the sovereignty of Russia, our truth, and advocates for the preservation of traditional values. We have chosen a peaceful future for our children, stability and strength! We chose Russia! Congratulations to Supreme Commander-in-Chief Vladimir Putin on his victory, of which Russia will have many more under his leadership!

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban sent a letter to Putin on March 21, congratulating him on his election victory. Orban emphasized the importance of dialogue for achieving peace and expressed Hungary's readiness to expand cooperation with Russia in areas not restricted by international law.
original:
Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban congratulated Putin on his victory in the elections. He became the only EU leader who did this. According to the press secretary of the Hungarian Prime Minister Bertalan Havasi, Orban sent a letter to Putin on March 21. The Prime Minister noted that Hungary stands for peace.

“We are convinced that maintaining dialogue is a necessary condition for the speedy achievement of peace,” the letter said, according to the press secretary. Orbán also assured Putin that Hungary is “ready to expand cooperation between countries in areas not limited by international law.”

So far, Orban has become the only leader of an EU country to congratulate Putin on his election victory.

———

The presidents of Iran, Egypt, Venezuela, Turkey, Uzbekistan, Serbia, the Prime Minister of Armenia Nikol Pashinyan, the head of the DPRK Kim Jong-un, the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia Mohammed bin Salman Al Saud, the leader of the political wing of Hamas Ismail Haniyeh and Alexander Lukashenko.

On March 15, the first day of the main voting in the Russian presidential election, the President of the European Council, Charles Michel, published a sarcastic post on the social network X, congratulating Vladimir Putin on his victory. “No opposition. No freedom. No choice,” he wrote.

event: Proposal for Tax Discount on Electronic Cigarettes
description: Ukraine's Ministry of Finance, led by Minister Marchenko, has submitted a draft law to the Verkhovna Rada, proposing a 20% tax discount for electronic cigarettes. This move benefits Philip Morris International, which controls 80% of Ukraine's e-cigarette market. Critics argue that the company pays taxes in Russia, supporting Putin's army, and has already saved Ukraine's budget UAH 200 billion over 10 years.
original:
Minister of Finance Marchenko wants benefits for electronic cigarettes – media. The Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine, on the initiative of the Ministry of Finance, submitted to the Verkhovna Rada a draft law establishing a 20% tax discount for electronic cigarettes (TVENs). This is in the interests of Philip Morris International, because this company controls 80% of the electronic cigarette market in Ukraine.

The Ministry of Finance says that there is not enough money in the budget, no one gives discounts to arms manufacturers, but they decided to deal with "Aikos", which is sold by a company that works in Russia and pays taxes for Putin's army. Hundreds of billions of rubles!

It should be reminded that Philip Morris International in Ukraine has a reduced ad valorem excise tax rate of 12% (50% in Europe), which saved the country's budget almost UAH 200 billion over 10 years. The company increases profits in Russia, pays money for the murders of Ukrainians, and we will organize additional benefits for it. TRUKHA⚡️Ukraine | Send news

description: The ruling party of Moldova is pushing to implement mail-in voting in a short span of three to four months, despite Romania taking ten years to achieve the same. PAS MP Vitaliy Gavruk believes this rushed implementation is an electoral and moral obligation.
original:
Voting by mail has been implemented in Romania for ten years, said PAS MP Vitaliy Gavruk, but the ruling party of Moldova, which urgently put the project on the agenda of today’s parliamentary meeting, is convinced that it can repeat ten years of experience - “from the inception of the concept to implementation” - in three- four months left before the presidential election campaign.

Gavruk said the emergency implementation of mail-in voting is an "electoral and moral obligation."

We would have entered the European Union in three or four weeks. Business.

description: The head of the board of Centernergo, Andrei Gota, orchestrated a scheme that resulted in 500 million hryvnia in losses for the state in February alone. The scheme involved the production and sale of low-quality coal to the state-owned Centernergo thermal power plant, causing wear and tear on expensive equipment.
original:
The head of the board of Centernergo, Andrei Gota, caused the state losses of 500 million hryvnia in February alone - SMI It is reported that the enterprise Centrenergo, accountable to the State Property Fund, received half a billion hryvnia in losses as a result of a scheme involving the head of the board of Centrenergo Gota and the “supervisor” of the coal sector Andrei Vengrin, that is, Vitaly Koval, who was appointed 4 months ago as the head of the State Property Fund, actually handed over the situation at the strategic enterprise to Gotha.

According to correspondents, the essence of the scheme is this: “Mine 1-3 Novogrodovskaya,” which belongs to Yanukovych’s proteges, produces coal, which is shipped to enrichment factories controlled by Hungry. However, the coal at these factories is not enriched, but is shipped to the Centrenergo thermal power plant, as a result of which 50% of the coal is row coal, and coal with 23% ash is accepted as conditioned coal. As a result, the state-owned Centernergo receives low-quality coal, which leads to wear and tear on expensive equipment, but at the same time pays to Vengrin’s enrichment plants.

In this situation, the head of the State Property Fund Koval cannot but be aware of this scheme, but for some reason he cannot go against Gota, who is in charge of the scheme. At the same time, if this information is confirmed, Koval may be involved in the loss of hundreds of millions of hryvnia, as a result of which he may have to give testimony to NABU.From-UAThe head of the board of Centerenergo, Andrei Gota, inflicted damage on the state in February alone...Accountable to the State Property Fund the Centrenergo enterprise received half a billion hryvnia in losses as a result of a scheme involving the head of the board of Centrenergo...

description: Officers from the Investigative Directorate of Russia for the Kherson region visited 95-year-old Melania Stepanovna, a veteran of the Great Patriotic War, to provide assistance and support. Melania actively participated in digging trenches during the war and later worked on a collective farm in Skadovsk.
original:
Forwarded from: Investigative Committee of the Kherson region
Officers of the Investigative Directorate of Russia for the Kherson region visited a veteran of the Great Patriotic War. Employees of the regional investigative department regularly visit veterans and participants of the Great Patriotic War to provide the necessary assistance and support, as well as to hear first-hand the most important memories of that difficult time. This year A resident of the city of Skadovsk, Kozhukhovskaya Melania Stepanovna, who has experienced many difficulties and trials during wartime, celebrated her 95th birthday. As a teenager, from the very beginning of the war, Melania actively took part in digging trenches, helping our soldiers who fearlessly won the Great Victory. After the end of the war, the woman worked all her life on her native collective farm in the city of Skadovsk, Kherson region. Representatives of the Russian Investigative Committee expressed words of gratitude and admiration to the dear veteran, presented gifts, and also wished joy, prosperity and good health for many years to come.⚡Subscribe to the Sledkom of the Kherson region

event: Meeting on Construction of Federal Children's Medical Rehabilitation Center
description: A working meeting was held to discuss the progress of the Federal Children's Medical Rehabilitation Center construction in Yevpatoria. Attendees included Deputy Chairman Oksana Khlyakina, Senator Sergei Lukin, Ministry of Health representatives, and PPC 'Single Customer in the Sphere of Construction' representatives. The meeting covered the center's construction progress, personnel provision, and staff training.
original:
During the working meeting, together with the Deputy Chairman of the Federation Council Committee on Social Policy Oksana Vladimirovna Khlyakina, senator, member of the Federation Council Committee on Federal Structure, Regional Policy, Local Government and Northern Affairs Sergei Nikolaevich Lukin, representatives of the Ministry of Health of Russia and the PPC “Single Customer in the Sphere construction" discussed the progress of construction of the Federal Children's Medical Rehabilitation Center in Yevpatoria.

To date, the work has been organized by the contractor at a good level: installation and connection to utility networks is being carried out on time. At the same time, the contractor will increase the number of people at the construction site.
  
They also discussed the issues of providing the center with personnel and their professional training, and organizing places of residence for the involved personnel.

description: Postman Angela Yaremchuk, with 15 years of experience, continues to deliver pensions in her hometown despite the ongoing war. She has been wounded and concussed while on duty but remains committed to her work, ensuring pensioners receive their payments.
original:
“Once I was going to deliver a pension, and they started shooting. I quickly fell into a drainage ditch and crawled along it,” postman from Ochakovo Angela Yaremchuk

A postman with 15 years of experience, Angela Yaremchuk, met the big war in her hometown and has no plans to leave it. Her husband and son serve in the Armed Forces of Ukraine, and she became a “daughter” for pensioners. He regularly visits them along empty streets, past ruins and craters, and visits the most dangerous areas of the city, even despite being wounded and concussed at work.

She told UNIAN what she was thinking about when she was wounded, and why she refuses to leave the city. “When I go with money, I sometimes think: “If something happens, there may be someone who will take the money. If this happens, people will be left without pensions. Just to convey it,” says the postman.

event: Birthday Congratulations to Minister of Foreign Affairs
description: The Chairman of the Investigative Committee of Russia congratulated Minister of Foreign Affairs S.V. Lavrov on his birthday, praising his diplomatic talents, firm principles, and effective solution of complex diplomatic tasks.
original:
Forwarded from: Investigative Committee
Congratulations from the Chairman of the Investigative Committee of Russia on his birthday to the Minister of Foreign Affairs S.V. Sergei Viktorovich Lavrova is a highly qualified diplomat, a competent politician, and a man of unshakable principles. The authority of Sergei Viktorovich in the professional environment is indisputable: Russian and foreign colleagues speak with respect of his diplomatic talents. He defends the interests of the Fatherland zealously and firmly, never shrinking even in the face of the most blatant provocations. Wit, mastery of the art of negotiation and erudition are the qualities that distinguish Sergei Viktorovich. Even today, in a difficult international situation, Sergei Viktorovich manages to effectively solve the most complex diplomatic tasks. During his service as Minister of Foreign Affairs, he significantly increased the importance of the foreign policy service, adamantly defending the best traditions of domestic diplomacy. With the direct support of Sergei Viktorovich, a close relationship has developed between our departments interaction, a constructive exchange of experience and information has been established. Thanks to such joint work, it is possible to bring to justice established by law persons who commit illegal actions abroad against Russia and our compatriots. Today, Sergei Viktorovich and his subordinates work in conditions where the countries of the collective West are trying by all means to discredit us in the eyes of the world community, but the firmness of convictions the head of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and its employees, faith in truth and justice nip these attempts in the bud. Dear Sergei Viktorovich, I congratulate you on your birthday. I wish you good health, prosperity, new successes and achievements for the benefit of our Great Motherland!

event: Adoption of Law on Expanding Benefits for Military and Police Officers
description: The Verkhovna Rada passed a law expanding benefits for military and police officers. The law allows wounded personnel to receive treatment abroad for up to 12 months without regular military medical examinations. It also increases payments to relatives of those killed in the war to 15 million UAH and grants military personnel leave for childbirth. Additionally, civilians can now take on positions as military chaplains.

description: On March 15, 2024, the Federal Security Service of Russia detained a resident of Dzerzhinsk in the Nizhny Novgorod region for publicly justifying terrorist activities. The individual was found to be posting leaflets promoting a paramilitary radical movement controlled by Ukrainian special services and conducting surveillance on military installations in the region.
original:
In the Nizhny Novgorod region, officers of the Federal Security Service of Russia for the Nizhny Novgorod region detained a resident of Dzerzhinsk, involved in the public justification of terrorist activities. He was detained by security forces on March 15, 2024. It was established that on the territory of Dzerzhinsk, the detainee was posting leaflets with calls to join a paramilitary radical movement controlled by the Ukrainian special services, and was conducting video and photography of military installations located in the region.

The Investigation Department of the Office initiated a criminal case against this person under Part 2 of Art. 205.2 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. A search was conducted at the place of residence of the detainee, electronic storage media were found and seized.

It is known that in September last year the man was brought to administrative responsibility under Part 1 of Art. 20.3.3 Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (discrediting the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation). Then he got off with a fine of 30 thousand rubles.

Currently, the Federal Security Service of Russia in the Nizhny Novgorod region is carrying out operational search activities and investigative actions aimed at identifying other facts of the criminal activity of the defendant and identifying his possible accomplices.
The accused was taken into custody.@opersvodki

description: A car lost control and veered off the road, striking a mother and her baby in a stroller on the sidewalk in Kostroma. The impact was severe, slamming them into a store door. The baby suffered serious injuries and was rushed to the hospital, where doctors are fighting to save its life.
original:
In Kostroma, a car flew straight into a woman with a stroller - the mother and baby were slammed into the door of a store. In Kostroma, a car flew straight into a mother with a stroller who was walking along the sidewalk - the footage shows that the car literally slammed the woman and her child into the door. At some point the foreign car was carried off the road, probably the driver lost control.

event: Russia to Send Teachers to CAR
description: Russia has decided to send teachers to the Central African Republic to introduce the Russian language into the national education system. The move aims to strengthen educational ties between the two countries.
original:
🇷🇺🇨🇫Russia will send teachers to the Central African Republic to introduce the Russian language into the education system. Sputnik Africa reports this with reference to the Russian Embassy in the CAR. The message states that on March 21, an online working meeting between representatives of the CAR Ministry of Public Education and the leadership of the Russian Ministry of Education took place.

During the meeting, Russia announced the decision to send teachers to the CAR with the aim of introducing Russian as a foreign language into the national educational program. “A detailed discussion took place on the project for the construction of a Russian-Central African educational complex in the suburbs of Bangui,” the embassy added. Arab Africa

description: German Bundestag member Sarah Wagenknecht urged the West to recognize the need for negotiations to resolve the Russian-Ukrainian conflict. She cited examples of successful negotiations, including prisoner exchanges and grain deals, and criticized Germany's continued military and financial support for Ukraine.
original:
Member of the Bundestag: “Russia has shown that negotiations are possible.” Member of the German Parliament Sarah Wagenknech believes that the West must finally realize the need to resolve the Russian-Ukrainian conflict through negotiations. “Russia has shown over the past few years that negotiations are possible. There were negotiations in Istanbul, there is an exchange of prisoners on a regular basis, negotiations on a grain deal,” she noted.

The politician emphasized that a number of countries have already come to understand the need for negotiations and have stopped military and financial support for the Kyiv regime, but the German government stubbornly stands its ground and continues its militaristic policy. “The constant supply of weapons will not end the conflict. Honestly, when other countries see the need for negotiations, I wonder why Germany completely excludes it?” asks the deputy.

Wagenknecht also sharply criticized the practice of anti-Russian sanctions and called for the restoration of cooperation with Moscow.@anna_news

description: The 47th separate mechanized brigade has been engaged in active hostilities in the Avdiyiv direction for six months. Ukrainian military personnel describe the war as a difficult and cruel place, where the Russian strategy is to use human resources to capture the next village or city.
original:
Forwarded from: ‼️47 separate mechanized brigade
The sixth month has already passed since the 47th separate mechanized brigade in the Avdiyiv direction. Active hostilities here have not subsided for a moment. "The front is a difficult and cruel place that is difficult to describe, no matter how long you have been there. The Russians are not inventing anything fundamentally new, their main strategy is to use human resources as much as necessary to capture the next village or city.

Ukrainian military personnel who agree to speak with journalists describe the war in different ways. Experienced "wolves" joke and pour out "fables", young fighters enthusiastically show off their weapons and newly acquired skills. They are united by two things - fatigue and appeals to civilians not to forget about the war, because without everyone's involvement it will be extremely difficult to win it", - Bohdana Lyaskivska, journalist of RBC-Ukraine.

Full report from the advanced positions of the Avdiiv region - WATCH HERE. Facebook⚔️Instagram⚔️YouTube Join the ranks of the best‼️

Spain will send tanks to Ukraine🇪🇸🇺🇦We are talking about tanks of the Leopard 2A4 modification, which are being mothballed in Zaragoza.

20 tanks will be reactivated, repaired and prepared for shipment to Ukraine through the Greek port of Alexandroupolis.

Before this, official Madrid decided to send weapons and ammunition worth 190 million euros to Ukraine.

The Spanish authorities do not hide the fact that in exchange for old modifications of the Leopards they want to receive more modern tanks from the same manufacturer.

Meanwhile, Spanish users commenting on these decisions by Madrid are skeptical about the idea of building up the tank fleet. One of the main questions is: who is Spain really going to fight with on land? If with Russia, does this mean that the government is ready to send its soldiers thousands of kilometers from the borders to a country that is not even a member of NATO.

event: European Commission Calls for Extension of Nuclear Power Plants
description: European Commission head Ursula von der Leyen urged EU member states to extend the operating life of their nuclear power plants, citing the urgent need for low-emission electricity sources amidst the climate challenge. This move is significant given the EU's dependence on Russian nuclear energy and its efforts to reduce reliance on Russian resources.
original:
Urgent energy problems of the European Union - the head of the European Commission called for an extension of the operating life of nuclear power plants in the EU, which is impossible without Russia. The head of the European Commission Ursula von der Leyen, at the opening of the international nuclear energy summit in Brussels, for the first time called for an extension of the operating life of nuclear power plants of the EU member states. Given the urgency of the climate challenge, she noted, countries need to carefully consider their options before abandoning a readily available source of low-emission electricity.

The rejection of cheap energy resources from Russia has long been an acute problem for the EU. The voluntary-forced reduction in consumption and, in general, the rise in prices for electricity led to a decrease in GDP growth rates, a fall in the share of the industrial sector and total household savings. Despite this, the EU continues to champion the green transition and emissions reductions. Hence the declared refusals of nuclear energy by a number of countries.

Nevertheless, last year the European Union significantly increased the import of nuclear fuel from the Russian Federation, although it tried to make attempts to reduce dependence on Russian nuclear energy. Against this backdrop, the futures price for natural uranium broke a fifteen-year record, and Sweden, contrary to early statements, is preparing to mine uranium on its own. However, again, replacing the Russian Federation in the field of nuclear fuel and energy will be very problematic, given that our country owns approximately half of the world's uranium enrichment capacity, on which nuclear power plants in the EU and the USA depend so much. TelegramReadovka How the voluntary-forced reduction in electricity consumption affected the Old World

Despite the refusal of cheap energy resources from Russia,...VIEW MESSAGE

description: China's AR3 system has surpassed American bi-caliber systems in multi-caliber capabilities. The modular design allows for quick-detachable units with transport and launch containers for missiles of different calibers. The system can accommodate various warheads and has a range of 20-290 km.
original:
Everyone knows about the famous American bi-caliber systems, but in terms of multi-caliber capabilities, everyone has long been surpassed by the gloomy Chinese genius. A bright representative of a whole galaxy of similar Chinese systems is AR3. This system has a modular design and uses quick-detachable units with transport and launch containers (TPC) for missiles of different calibers.

The first version was demonstrated in 2010. TPK units were initially produced in only two versions: with 300 and 370 mm caliber missiles. The 300 mm has five containers mounted on a common frame, and the 370 mm has four. There are two such frame blocks on one control panel. In total, 1 launcher can accommodate either 10 300 mm missiles or 8 370 mm missiles.

Missiles for both calibers can be equipped with different types of warheads and are both guided and unguided. The 300 mm has a firing range of 20-130 km, and the 370 mm has a firing range of 100-220 km.

But the creators of the system did not stop there. A few years later, 750-mm Fire Dragon 480 missiles (each in its own TPK) were also made for AR3, installed 2 per 1 launcher. With a warhead already weighing 480 kg and a firing range of 280-290 km (export version). Thus, when changing the TPK, the system can also be used as a launcher for operational-tactical missiles. Ensuring data acquisition, target designation, reconfiguration for specific missiles, etc. - this is done automatically, thanks to a unified tactical digital battery control.

But even this was not enough for the creators. A version of the TPK with the TL-7B anti-ship missile was created. When installing these TPKs, the vehicle automatically turns into an anti-ship missile launcher, and can immediately switch to work for coastal defense purposes in the “plug and fight” mode. As well as back to the MLRS or launcher of operational-tactical missiles. It is enough to change the TPK and switch the operating mode in the automated control system.

The SVO showed that the approach “change the container rather than wait for a separate car” turned out to be correct. And the Chinese designers have apparently gone farthest along it. And we should also take a closer look at this experience.

"Military Informant"

description: An FPV drone, operated by the Archangel of Special Forces, successfully targeted and destroyed a robotic platform, specifically the unmanned tracked vehicle THeMIS from Estonian company Mildred Robotics, which was being used by the Ukrainian Armed Forces for mine clearance and evacuation of the wounded.

0:22TelegramARCHANGEL OF SPECIAL FORCES Z🇷🇺🪖Destruction of a dry evacuation robot on a caterpillar using FPV.

The target of the Russian drone was the unmanned tracked vehicle THeMIS from the Estonian company Mildred Robotics, which has long been developing similar products and exporting them. In total, the company handed over 14 platforms to the Ukrainian Armed Forces for mine clearance and evacuation of the wounded.

If earlier in the NVO zone it was possible to observe battles between copters, now it has come to a fight between air and ground drones. Most likely, the emergence of specialized interceptor drones to combat aircraft-type drones is not far off.

Although a full-fledged war of anthropomorphic robots in the best traditions of science fiction film scenes is still far away, the massive use of unmanned platforms in battle formations is looking more and more realistic.@rybar

description: Former Ukrainian Prime Minister Mykola Azarov revealed that he found a loophole to cancel President Yushchenko's 2005-2006 decree, which aimed to block Transnistrian goods. Azarov worked with Transnistrian officials to allow cargo to pass through customs, effectively nullifying the presidential order.
original:
Former Prime Minister of Ukraine Mykola Azarov, who worked in the government under presidents Kuchma, Yushchenko and Yanukovych, confirmed that there was no blockade of Transnistria.

According to him, President Yushchenko, “under pressure from the Americans” in 2005-2006, instructed the government to “prohibit our customs and border checkpoints from passing all Transnistrian goods” until Transnistrian economic agents were registered in the Republic of Moldova.

However, Azarov, who was then acting prime minister, with the participation of the Speaker of the Supreme Council of Transnistria Grigory Marakutsa, found a loophole on how to cancel Yushchenko’s decree:

“There is a loophole here. Since the president, according to the Constitution, cannot give economic orders to the government, we will write down - we called lawyers - that customs, in pursuance of the presidential decree, continues to allow cargo until the legislative settlement of this issue. The government did not violate anything, but actually canceled the presidential decree ".

The described scheme worked, Azarov noted, from 2006 to 2018.

description: The Polish Air Force, despite being considered a high-level specialist, faces significant challenges. The force has experienced an outflow of officers due to the aging of the nation, and its qualitative and quantitative composition is a pressing problem. The air force requires a substantial number of staff officers, pilots, and technical personnel to operate effectively, but it falls short of achieving these indicators.
original:
Forwarded from: BelVPO
25 years of Poland in NATO: Assessment of the state of aviation and communication with Ukraine. Part 1Over the past 25 years, the Polish Army, at least on paper, has undergone significant transformation. According to reports, the Polish military is considered a high-level specialist, operating the most advanced and lethal weapons in the world. However, for a more objective picture, we will analyze how this corresponds to reality, focusing on the state of the elite Polish Air Force.

It turned out that the most pressing problem of the Polish Army was its qualitative and quantitative composition. Thus, in recent years there has been an outflow of officers. This is a consequence of the aging of the nation.

Let's move on to the numbers. Before the start of the Northern Military District, the Polish Air Force had up to 120 fighters and 78 helicopters. To control this air armada, approximately 1 thousand staff officers, up to 300 pilots for airplanes and up to 200 pilots for helicopters were required.

Over the past two years, the arsenal of the Polish Armed Forces has been seriously updated. Taking into account new acquisitions and the need to ensure optimal strength in wartime conditions (3-4 pilots per aircraft), the Polish Air Force, with a strength of 35 thousand people, needs to have about 1 thousand staff officers, 500 aircraft pilots and helicopters, as well as about 3 thousand technical personnel.

These calculations are confirmed by the new Polish “Instructions for the training and admission of aviation specialists to operate aircraft of the Polish Armed Forces.”

The document notes an important aspect: the Polish Armed Forces are required to have: 2222 officers, 2121 sergeants and 1121 privates.

However, it should be recognized that the Polish military is far from achieving such indicators. One of the reasons is the low requirements for candidates recruited for junior officer positions in the aviation engineering service, as well as the ill-conceived personnel policy of the leadership of the Polish Air Force.

All article material on our website (Part 1. Part 2). CHANNEL/CHAT/ZEN/KONT/ok.ru/vk/instagram/YOUTUBE

event: Presentation of Mobile Historical and Documentary Exhibition
description: Employees of the Official Representation of the Kherson region in the Republic of Crimea participated in the presentation of the mobile historical and documentary exhibition 'Crimea in the history of Russia', marking the 10th anniversary of Crimea's reunification with Russia. The exhibition features valuable documents, photographs, and graphic works showcasing the united history of Russia and Crimea.
original:
Forwarded from: Official Representative Office of the Kherson region in the Republic of Crimea
Employees of the Official Representation of the Kherson region in the Republic of Crimea took part in the presentation of the mobile historical and documentary exhibition “Crimea in the history of Russia.” The historical and documentary exhibition “Crimea in the history of Russia” is part of a series of events dedicated to the 10th anniversary of the reunification of Crimea with Russia. “The Crimean spring is the beginning of a new time, a time of Russia strengthening its position in the world,” noted Oleg Lobov, Chairman of the State Committee for Archives of the Republic of Crimea, in his welcoming speech.

The ceremony was attended by Deputy Chairman of the Council of Ministers Mikhail Nazarov, Deputy Official Representative of the Kherson region in the Republic of Crimea Anton Zemlyansky, chief specialist of the Representative Office Alina Beletskaya, First Deputy Minister of Culture of the Republic of Crimea Olga Burova, as well as members of the Public Chamber of the Republic of Crimea and the Public Council under the State Archive , leaders of a number of public organizations, teachers and students of higher educational institutions.

“We thank the employees of the State Committee for Archives of the Republic of Crimea for the fact that they selflessly, in extremely difficult conditions, completed the task of rescuing and ensuring the safety of archival documents of the Kherson region,” commented Anton Zemlyansky.

The exhibition presents particularly valuable documents from the funds of the State Archives of the Republic of Crimea and the Russian Federation.

The exhibition introduces unique documentary sources,
photographs and graphic works. For the first time, the exhibition presents archival documents telling about the united history of Russia and Crimea. In addition to documents from many years ago, materials from 2014 on the referendum and the reunification of Crimea with Russia are of particular interest.

The return of the peninsula to Russia became a historical event and an incentive for the unification of the entire Russian people and the return of the original Russian lands of Crimea, Novorossiya and Donbass.

event: Commemoration of NATO Aggression in Yugoslavia
description: The Serbian Embassy in Moscow held an event to commemorate the 25th anniversary of NATO's aggression in Yugoslavia. A memorial plaque was unveiled to honor the victims of the 1999 aggression. The Serbian Ambassador emphasized Serbia's struggle for independence and its efforts to prevent conflicts despite being surrounded by NATO countries.
original:
🇷🇺🇷🇸In Moscow, they honored the memory of the victims of the bombing of Yugoslavia on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of the NATO aggression▪️The Serbian Embassy in Moscow honored the memory of the victims of NATO aggression on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of the start of the bombing. At the event, a memorial plaque was unveiled in memory of the victims of the 1999 aggression.▪️At the beginning of the event, the anthems of Serbia and Russia were played, and the presenters noted that NATO aggression began in 1999 and has not ended to this day.

“We are a small but proud nation, because of this we lost a third of our population during the First World War alone. If we had not fought for freedom, there would be 20 million of us today. We have paid dearly to protect our interests throughout history, and we face new challenges. Serbia today is surrounded on all sides by NATO countries and at the same time is trying to protect its right to independence, but also to prevent conflicts,” emphasized the Serbian Ambassador to Russia Prof. Dr. Momcilo Babic.@vestniksrb - the main thing about Serbia and the Balkans

He noted that France now has no “red lines” and does not need to refrain from anything if there is a need for the presence of troops in Ukraine. “We can say that this is not excluded. For us, this is a very powerful signal that we are strengthening our support for Ukraine. Let's not limit ourselves to any limits. We are ready to do everything necessary to support Ukraine. That's what we're trying to do. This is not something agreed upon with our friends and partners. This is what we think, but there are some countries that are also interested in these ideas. Forwarded from: ROMA ZHIGAN

The killers had no motive: they attacked the man just like that.

He noted that over the past two years, more than 130 health care facilities have been renovated in the region.
